intro: Encholirium kranzianum, commonly known as the Kranzian cupuaçu, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 2 meters, featuring large, palmate leaves with a waxy surface. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains edible seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of nutrients. The plant is adapted to the humid, tropical conditions of its native habitat.
